title: Absolutely EXCELLENT ‼️❤️👍🏻
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Thank s
review: Loved loved loved this Hotel! The staff excellent! Room with terrace, excellent! Location absolutely FABULOUS!!!! Right by Taksim Square! Absolutely LOVED our stay here!!!!! Book you won’t be disappointed! Would go back here for sure! Thank you!

title: GREAT EXPERIENCE IN A BEAUTIFUL HOTEL
review: I would like to thank everybody in this hotel mohaned and hafiz Allah and  wedat and ingi  thanks for everything  . Clean hotel .safe  ,nice view ,good location ,wide room clean  ,nearby market and Taksim Meydani and İstiklal street

title: Süper Oldu, Clean & Convenient Location
review: Friendly staff spacious room with breathtaking Bosphorus view the location was close to Taksim square and easy access to metro station and a few steps far from Istiklal street I cant wait to go back again

title: Great place to stay
review: Preferred to stay in Cihangir as was going to a milonga (tango dancing) in the area that evening and wanted an option other than hostel. Suitel was just about perfect: the most comfortable king size bed, spacious room with desk, armoire closet, two night tables and cozy chair beside the window.  The reception, Engin was helpful when I asked if I might see the room prior to making a decision.   There’s a garden out back past the lobby though appeared they might be renovating.  I’d consider Suitel 5 stars if breakfast could be included. Note: there are plenty of local eateries for a delish Turkish breakfast. I tried Çağdaş Börek which is less than 5 minutes away (ask at the hotel).  Istanbul is a magical place & very dear to my heart ❤️🇹🇷❤️

title: really beautiful hotel
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: The hotel is completely different from how it is advertised
review: Loved the room. it was so beautiful. the decor, the furniture were all beautifully chosen and gave the royalty feel. Comfortable bed for both my duaghter and I. The croom and toilet was sparkling clean.

title: An antique Building with a calm and friendly environment and a superb sea view balcony.
review: The hotel is basically a shabby and neglected version of what you see on this website (the pictures uploaded speak by themselves and are only a small part of the “surprises” you will find). The Room was dusty and dirty, forniture well-worn; the lobby and the bar completely disregarded; the personnel - exception made for the last guy we met at the reception - very unfriendly and annoyed by our requests (basically we wanted our room properly cleaned); the view on the Bosphorus is impaired by a staircase and the wild vegetation left untrimmed. Bottom line this hotel doesn’t worth the price it asks for its rooms and I’m surprised that tripadvisor.com allows on its website to have such huge misrepresentation of the services offered.

title: Money Value Perfect Location
review: Me and my wife were stayed there for 2 nights on the first floor the sea view twin bed. The room had a high ceiling and wooden walls and floors and overall had a Victorian look on it. The staff was very friendly and the amenities were functional. We visited suitel Bosphorus on the march.  Will totally recommend it and absolutely will come back again.

title: money value experience
review: i stayed 22 to 24 Jan 2018 in this hotel, perfect location, best view, nice staff, best location for bachelor and night life, Taksim Square and Istiklal street on few steps. the room was very clean, the bedding was very nice and TV LCD was very good with perfect mini bar.

title: Avearge
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Average Hotel, Average Service
review: Not fully satisfied as it was not as clean as i expect as i arrived on time but it needs cleaning  Location is very good and very near to taksim square and metro station Also the room size is very good  Staff are friendly   Recommend to stay sure

title: Very Nice View of Bosphorus
review: Hotel cancelled my property 25minutes after i checked in due to being overbooked. The room i wanted wasnt available and they gave me a normal room. Reported to Booking.com that i was a no show when i already informed them my check in time. Lift broke down during my stay. Noisy neighbourhood. Not recommended as it is not suitable for kids or families.  For the price, dont expect much..  Pros: Hotel near metro and bus interchange.

title: perfect hotel
review: Very helpful staff, beautiful room and excellent view of Bosphorus. Thanks for the staff to arrange our transport to airport early in the morning as we had an early flight to Cappadocia and he make sure we get a good taxi as some of the taxi in Istanbul will cheat you with their meter or trick with your money. You can search online about Istanbul taxi scam. Overall about this hotel is Excellent and we love to come and visit Istanbul again.

title: Great Location
review: its very nice room arround 45 m2 , the furniture so new and luxury, the bed is comfortable , the stufff is so helpfull, the price is very nice for this kind of hotel, because its lux and in the center of the center. u can reach everywhere so quickly and easly ,

title: The suitel bosporus
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. title: My home in Istanbul
review: Very kind and friendly people.beautiful rooms ,fantastic view.thanks you for the best accomodation.the rooms are very clean .the hotel  Is very close to the station and taxim.very nice breakfast ',,,,,,

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: Dear Our Guest; Thank you very much for the time to review our hotel  We are happy to hear that you had a nice stay.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed all hotel facilities,staff , location and appreciated our service quality. Thank you for choosing us , we look forward to welcoming you back next time! Best Wishes from  from SUİTEL BOSPHORus Family  Best Regards Havzullah BAYHAN Front Desk Manager

title: Great hotel
review: The Suitel Bosphorus is a nice hotel in a very quite street, just  steps away from a very busy Taxim Square. I keep coming back to this hotel since almost two years already. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. Gorgeous view of the Bosphorus. Very friendly and accommodating staff, immediately attending to any request. Fantastic location. Nice breakfast. Tea and coffee maker in the room. Very good value for money. I recommended this hotel to my friends and they found it very good, too. Would recommend Suitel Bosphorus to any traveler going to this wonderful city.

title: Nice boutique hotel
review: Dear Maria ; Thank you very much for the time to review our hotel  We are happy to hear that you had a nice stay.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed all hotel facilities,staff , location and appreciated our service quality. Thank you for choosing us , we look forward to welcoming you back next time! Best Wishes from  from SUİTEL BOSPHORus Family  Best Regards Havzullah BAYHAN Front Desk Manager

title: Amazing city break
review: Everything about the suitel bosphorus is just perfect! Staff super friendly, they gave us the istanbul card, they called us a cab, very helpfull. Now lets talk about the perfect location , 30 seconds to istiklal street!!! I definitely recommend this place!

title: Very Good!
review: Dear Sallykhadra ;  I would like to thank you for your review and appreciate your kind comment.  We are delighted that you have enjoyed your vacation .And thank you so much againf for sharing informatioan about our hotel location  Our mission is to make our guests happy and like to let them feel like their own house here.  we look forward to see you again  Havzullah Bayhan Front Office Managaer

title: Excellent hotel
review: Can't go wrong it's just 200 Mts from istiklal amazing staff  over exceeded my expectations well furnished rooms decent breakfast nice view of the Bosporus walking distance from everything. Thanks guys

title: Pre-Cruise Hotel
review: Dear Daniel k ;  I would like to thank you for your review and appreciate your kind comment.  We are delighted that you have enjoyed your vacation .And thank you so much againf for sharing informatioan about our hotel location  Our mission is to make our guests happy and like to let them feel like their own house here.  we look forward to see you again  Havzullah Bayhan Front Office Managaer

title: Worst experience ever!
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Pleasure
review: The reception staff was super nice, but that doesn't help that our room was not clean, at all.. There was hair in the bed and the garbage bin with q-tips and durty stuff from the last guest. No counting that the view from our room was an erotic shop with red lights blinking all the time.. That happen on Friday eve so we had to leave looking for a new hotel walking on the streets of Istanbul.. They didn't want to reimburse me the money paid as their solution was cleaning the room in that moment.. Well up to you.. For me most important thing is to have clean sheets ..

title: 3 nights stay
review: Of the most fascinating trips to Turkey Taksim area. All employees are great especially Mr. Hifez Allah. Wonderful weather also helped increase enjoy the ride. Ask help workers in the hotel if it is exposed to the exploitation of the owners of the taxi.

title: Good Service & very nice stuff
review: Friendly and very helpful staff. Location is awesome and the room we stayed in is excellent. Well furnished, out of this world sea view and good room amenities. Will surely stay there again and would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Nice little hotel
review: The Personal was so nice and Friendly to us an to our daughter. We had a Really good Time there. Thank you so much. Good and nice people & service. The Location is awesome. We had the Train & Shops next to us.

title: Excellent overall !!!!!!!!!
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Excellent experience
review: Super Location. Only 1/2 mins walk to Taxim Square and Istikial Caddesi.  Where you can catch the trains also can do all your clothes shopping as well. Many restaurants are situated here.. The Rooms we stayed in was facing the Bosphorus river, which is looking over Kiz kulesi. This is a restaurant in the river. with lots of history to go with it. We enjoyed watching the boats from our balcony.  Rooms are good size which has a small bathroom with a hairdryer. Most of all the staff are very friendly and the breakfast was nice with lots of selections to choose from. I would highly recommend  Thanking all the staff at the hotel.  From Ozkan

title: Great hotel and staff
review: Dear OZKAN ;.  It was a great pleasure to host such a warm and welcoming personality like you here at SUITEL BOSPHORUS  Your review and all good pointing reviews are giving us such a great power and our staff is very proud with the service you enjoy.  Like to thank you for taking time to share your stunning review here on tripadvisor, we love to host you again like your own sweet home here SUITEL BOSPHORUS  Best Regards  Havzullah BAYHAN Front Desk Manager

title: Suitel hotel, Istanbul
review: Room clean and big excellent  river view very friendly staff ,pleanty of breakfast was fresh and home made cakes. The hotel I'd in the centre of taksim walking distance to local shops bars clubs etc. Thank you to all staff  From Vince.

title: An amazing experience!
review: Dear VıncE;.  It was a great pleasure to host such a warm and welcoming personality like you here at SUITEL BOSPHORUS  Your review and all good pointing reviews are giving us such a great power and our staff is very proud with the service you enjoy.  Like to thank you for taking time to share your stunning review here on tripadvisor, we love to host you again like your own sweet home here SUITEL BOSPHORUS Best Regards  Havzullah BAYHAN Front Desk Manager

title: fake views
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Location location location
review: It wasn't what I have seen  Totally small rooms has nothing of the photos on the terrace  breakfast was not fresh and you can't order food since they weren't equipped with kitchen facilities and cleanness

title: Excellent view and location
review: Staff was extremely helpful.it was very near to metro station. Carrefour mini was very near. The cleaning of the rooms were not satisfactory. Even the sheets were not changed in our three nights stay. There was a nespresso in the room but was not working.

title: best place so far
review: Located a very short walk to Taxim Square and Istikial street. Rooms facing the Bosphorus have a lovely view and are quiet without street noise. We enjoyed watching the marine traffic from the balcony. Rooms aren't massive but are more than adequate for a short stay with comfortable bed, loveseat and chairs and small bathroom with a hairdryer. The elevator was a definite plus. We were only there one night. Staff very friendly and helpful and were able to extend our check out until 1 pm then hold our luggage until our 4 pm departure.

title: Good value for money and quality facility
review: Been to Istanbul 5 times. If I were you, I would not stay anywhere else if in Taksim.  Staff are genuine and very friendly. Love the nespresso machines and you can also bring your favorite capsules with you... clean and tidy and near metro and you are basically within feets from everything.

title: Dmytro
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Amazing views
review: Perfect hotel. Will suggest to my buddies if they need to stay overnight in Istanbul. Very good, friendly and perfect stuff. Kind of room also perfect, mean room likes perfect and very pleasant to stay in it.

title: Seven nights with Bosphorus view
review: Amazing views, beautiful spacious rooms and bathe, lovely staff! The streets are busy and loud during the day but we don't hear any noise! We had a room overlooking  the sea the first night then updated to a bigger suite across the hall. Our family member stay down the street at the Ootomen Palace paid double what we paid and was very unhappy with the hotel services. They all loved our hotel. My husband, two year old daughter and myself never got a chance to really enjoy any anmenties due to our preplanned days but upon checkout we notice the beautiful  outdoor setting and wished we had a chance to take as enjoy the scenery. It was breathtaking. The only negative is the extremely small evalators but we made it work. (He had a full size stroller). Just a few minutes away from…

title: Highly recommended hotel
review: Special thanks to Mr.Ilyas and Mr.Havsullah for their friendly cooperation and help. Location of the hotel is in Taksim, 3 minutes walk from Istiklal street, the good thing is that the entrance is not in a crowded area.  The breakfast was a nice Turkish breakfast and they offered Turkish coffee whenever we asked. The rooms were comfortable and clean - If you're looking for a comfortable and quiet Bed and Breakfast with a nice view, this is the right hotel for you.

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed as a family one night in this hotel . Room is large ..very well prepared .. Reception guy was very helpful and friendly . Overall the hotel was very good and sure we will chose it for the next visit to Istanbul .

title: comfortable & enjoyable
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Fabulous!
review: The place is close to restaurants, Taqseem metro station, Isteqlal square and more. The neighborhood is quieter than the parallel streets nearby. The front desk guys were very helpful in the meal switch (we were fasting during the day, so they arranged the mid-night meal instead of breakfast) and were super friendly. Each floor has two rooms; sea view and city view. Ours was city view and I personally enjoyed watching passers and life style from above. Their airport shuttle service was better than taking a random cap and more comfortable.  (Thanks Ahmed, Hefzullah and third guy with glasses)

title: Very friendly personalities are not always enough!
review: Ended a cruise in Istanbul and stayed over an extra day. Looked online to find a hotel and wanted something nice, clean, not too large of a hotel but also something "Turkish"...This hotel was great. Met all our expectations and we were thrilled...The view of the Bosphurus was gorgeous, hotel staff was great and the attached restaurant had great food, nice staff and a beautiful view of the water as well.

title: Spectacular ❤️
review: Thank you for the staff in the hotel. They were friendly and supportive. However, the city view room for 3 persons was veeery small and not clean when we arrived. The WC was not prepared. The AC was not working, therefore, they brought a fan and the next day they moved us to bigger room with sea view (no extra charge), but the AC was not working as well. Honestly, there was no need for it in this room. We stayed for 6 days, 2 days of them without water from morning till evening !!!

title: egyption family
review: Dear Mahaa128 ;  Thank you so much to your warm reviews on Tripadvisor  and appreciate your kind comment about staff We believe that we can improve our services by the comments and suggestions of our guests. I would like to tell about water problems: That days no water all around Taksim 2 days.Because Municipality team fixed  main water line and they dont allow water in 2 days.We have water tank but ıt was just for 3-4 hours enough.  ı m so sorry again and I will be more than delighted to talk to you personally about this issue. Would you please provide us your contact information via e-mail at info@suitelbosphorus.com at your earliest convenience?  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to show you the service we are known for and to experience again Suitel Bosphorus, Istanbul.  Sincerely , Havzullah Bayha Front Office Manager

title: Friendly service and good location
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: The worst hotel experience in my life
review: My friend and I enjoyed staying at Suitel Bosphorus. The view from the room was nice and breakfast was good also with beautiful view. Since our days were filled w tours, we did not really take an advantage of the hotel location, but seems very convenient to go anywhere. Staffs were nice and very helpful, trying to meet our demand as much as they can. Love to stay again.

title: average
review: Dear Bosbos ;.  It was a great pleasure to host such a warm and welcoming personality like you here at SUITEL BOSPHORUS  Your review and all good pointing reviews are giving us such a great power and our staff is very proud with the service you enjoy.  Like to thank you for taking time to share your stunning review here on tripadvisor, we love to host you again like your own sweet home here SUITEL BOSPHORUS Best Regards  Havzullah BAYHAN Front Desk Manager

title: Nice place to stay
review: I got alluded by the beautiful views that EVERY room featured in the gallery of booking.com shows but when I got to the hotel I was given a room that overlooks the street. So I don't have the view of the sea and at 3 o'clock in the morning my husband, my daughter and me are all awake for the unbelievable noise that comes from the street. People screaming and shouting and honking their horns all night!! I complained and I wAs told that I had not specifically requested a room with a see view. I said that booking.com did not specify and that in any case my room was a suite and I could change it for a smaller one but i was told that there were no rooms available. I feel cheated as badly as I have never been in my entire life!!!!

title: Very helpful staff. Beautiful views of Bosphorus from terrace and bedrooms at the back of the building.
review: Dear PennyDG68 ;  Thank you for reviewing Suitel Bosphorus, Istanbul. We would like to sincerely apologize for the difficulties encountered during your stay.  I would like to inform about your room; You booked family suite and we write informaiton on Booking ,there is no view.The room which is have view names;Deluxe Suite with Bosphorus view.However if  we had available Bosphorus room  that time  Honestly we could upgarde your room.But there is not available any rooms.Because other guest booked so earlier.  Our hotel ıts heart of Istanbul on the Taksim.There are a lot of restaurants, shops, cafe and pubs. Because of thats resons ıt can be noisy friday and saturday nights.Also we have double windows To prevent sound and we advise, close window before sleeping to our guets.  I will be more than delighted to talk to you personally about this issue. Would you please provide us your contact information via e-mail at info@suitelbosphorus.com at your earliest convenience?  Sincerely ,  Havzullah Bayha Front Office Manager

title: Excellent location
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Great to stay
review: This vintage property is only a two minute walk from Istiklal and right in heart of taksim square. We were in the bosphorus view room and it was crazily romantic. The view is so peaceful! On our way back,we stayed two more nights in a city view room,can say that the rooms are very tastefully decorated with a certain victorian touch. The breakfast salon has a view of the bosphorus and has a fairly good selection.The staff is very helpful and will address all your queries on this gorgeous vibrant city of Istanbul!

title: 4 nights in Istanbul
review: Dear Swiya c ; Thank you so much to your warm reviews on Tripadvisor  We are delighted that you have enjoyed your vacation  Our mission is to make our guests happy and like to let them feel like their own house here.  we look forward to see you again  Havzullah Bayhan Front Office Managaer

title: Perfect place to stay
review: It is located near taksim square. It has nice view because of it's location.(we are in 3rd floor but nice bosphorus view.) Room was quite large and it seems renovated newly. And the managers are really kind to have given me umbrellas against sudden rain. If I go to Istanbul later, I will definitely  go to the hotel.! Thank you!

title: Suitel Bosphorus - Excellent Hospitality
review: Dear Varun T Many thanks for taking the time to leave a review about your stay at Suitel Bosphorus Hotel. Just as you have mentioned, we are perfectly located in the heart of Istanbul, which allows our guests to make the best of their time here. I have passed on your praise to the staff and all of us here would love to welcome you back when you happen to be in Istanbul again!   Your Sincerely Havzullah Bayhan Front Desk Manager

title: Lovely Stay in Suitel Bosphorus
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: 5 star hospitality
review: We flew in to Istanbul on March 19 for 2 days. The hotel has booked us a cab from the Airport. We got the room it was very clean and we had the view of the Bosphorus. The hotel was very near to Taksim Sq and Istikal street ( which is main area for clubs and pubs ) and it was surprisingly very quiet considering the fact it was tourist area. The hotel staff was very friendly  and they all spoke english which was very good. The hotel also provided us with breakfast which was also pretty good.  Overall we had nice time if i were to go back to Istanbul again i would definitely  stay there  Varun

title: Excellent!
review: Dear Stella C It’s was a pleasure for host you in our Hotel,and thank you for choosing us. It is really a big acess your opinion about our staff and hotel too. With the hope to host you again. Best Regards  Havzullah Bayhan Front Desk Manager

title: Wonderful view and perfect location
review: we really enjoyed our stay to this nice and clean family hotel. the breakfast was very good and tasty . Everyone was really friendly and helpful.  the room was big, clean, comfortable, and without noise. also the place of the hotel is was good, very easy to find.

title: Amazing Bosporus view, friendly staff and great location
review: Dear Stella C  Thank you so much to your warm reviews on Tripadvisor  We are delighted that you have enjoyed your vacation  Our mission is to make our guests happy and like to let them feel like their own house here.  we look forward to see you again  Havzullah Bayhan Front Office Managaer

title: Very causy hotel and relevant location
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Great stay at this hotel with very friendly,helpful staff and amazing Bosphorus view, and location
review: People are very friendly, the hotel has a unique identity with personalised style   Breakfast area is very nice and causy  Mr. Ahmed the recepcionist was very helpful and gentle   We booked a city view room but for next time we will upgrade for bosphorus view room

title: Spacious room  Best rate
review: Dear TALAL-HALABI ;  First of all, I would like to thank you to choose SUITEL BOSPHORUS for your Istanbul visit.  It was very kind of you to spare some of your time and convey us your comments regarding our services.It is a great pleasure to read that you all enjoyed your time with us and we ensured a memorable stay.I shared your review to Mr. Ahmed also.We are all sending regards for you  We would be more than happy to welcome you again in our hotel  All the best  Havzullah Bayhan Front Desk Manager

title: nice place
review: -Location, near Taksim square, metro, and Istiklal street -Very comfortable, cozy and the windows are soundproof so u don't hear anything outside your room -The staff were very helpful and friendly, and the service was perfect-the rooms with the bosphorus view are amazing, wake up early before the sunrise and enjoy the view -they gave us a metro/Bus card which helped us a lot in the transportation

title: Excelent service
review: Dear Zeina F ;  It was a great pleasure to host such a warm and welcoming personality like you here at SUITEL BOSPHORUS Istanbul Like to thank you for taking time to share your stunning review here on tripadvisor, we love to host you again like your own sweet home here at SUITEL BOSPHORUS Best Regards  Havzullah BAYHAN Front Desk Manager

title: Just perfect !
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. title: highly recommend!
review: Nice rooms with very nice panorama view on bosphorus , located in heart of taxim square , everything is near ( stores , restaurants , metro , tramway )  Very kind and lovely staff specially Havzullah who made our stay better ( he was very useful , he helped us to find the way , shown us what do do in istanbul and where to go ) , i'll recommand this hotel to every friend who's up to go in istanbul . Big Thanks Suitel Bosphorus ! I was very satisfied

title: Great stay
review: Dear Selma_kara ;  Thank you very much for telling us how much you have enjoyed your stay with us. it was great pleasure to host you in our hotel.And I m so happy to read coments about myself :).However  me and our all team always ready to help our guest.Its so cheerful for us to help our guests  Thank you again. We hope to be able to show you our own version of traditional Turkish hospitality again, when your future travels bring you to our end of the world.  we look forward to serve you on your future visits.  Sincerely,  Havzullah Bayhan Fron Desk Manager

title: nice hotel but noisy!
review: This hotel pretty much has it all: clean and comfortable accommodations, very strategic location, reasonable prices, extremely friendly and helpful staff, not to mention the great view and generous breakfast buffet! All of those attributes tend compensate for the overall noise level from the night clubs situated nearby.

title: An incredible stay during our Istanbul visit!
review: Dear Fatema F  We would like to thank you very much for your kind attention to our Hotel.It was ver kind of you to spare some of your time and convey us your comments regarding our services. We believe that we can improve our services by the comments and suggestions of our guests. We do appreciate your kind contribution to our perfection in this regard.  NOT : The club which is next to our door has been closed   It will be our pleasure to be your hosts again in the very near future.   We look forward to seeing you soon  Your sincerely  Havzullah Bayhan Fron Desk Manager

title: this is a boutique suite with an excellent location!!!
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Good Location, Friendly Staff
review: We had an excellent experiencie: nice rooms (suites), nice view, excellent location, wi-fi very good, one block walking to the metro station (metro, funicular, bus, train), everything you will need to visit the city

title: Excellent hotel
review: Dear Mariela B  I would like to thank you for your review and appreciate your kind comment.  We are delighted that you have enjoyed your vacation .And thank you so much againf for sharing informatioan about our hotel location  Our mission is to make our guests happy and like to let them feel like their own house here.  we look forward to see you again  Havzullah Bayhan Front Office Managaer

title: Quick stopover in Istanboul
review: Good Location. Near to Taksim square. Different cuisines you can find near about. Rooms are good. Staff is friendly and smiley always. Breakfast only an issue, same breakfast i have taken in my full stay of 11 nights and breakfast menu is soooooooooo short. One more thing; noise from the bar is disturbing till 4 am.

title: Cozy environment great view good location
review: Dear Muazzam S ;  Thank you for posting your feedback after your stay at Suitel Bosphorus.  all of our team members so happy and share thanks for you for powerfull reviews for us. It s very importand to see experience of our guest and we so care of they coments and we are improving with that reviews.And we will be better for breakfast  We look forward to see your futture visit to İstanbul and Suitel Bosphorus Your Sincerely  Havzullah Bayhan Front Desk Manager

title: great hotel good location
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. title: Centrally located & spacious
review: But if they put in in room 101 (should have known) :) even 201 .. ask for another room immediately as the noise from the street (nightclub, sirens, drunks) will keep u awake not good when u have an earlish flight... . other than that great location, great room, great service, great breakfast..

title: Best hotel in Taksim area!!
review: Dear Our Guets ;  Thank you to the choosing Suitel Bosphorus and your comments  we are so delighted to hear nice words from you  it s very importand to read your experience about our hotel and we will improve us with your value reviews.  we look forward to see your next travel to İstanbul  Your Sincerely ,  Havzullah Bayhan Front Office Manager

title: Central to Galata Tower and Taksim Square
review: We enjoyed our stay at the Suitel Bosphorus very much.  The room was very spacious with high ceilings, which in Istanbul is uncommon.  We loved that there was a large patio for breakfast and other times of the day when you needed a break to sit somewhere quietly.  The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. It can be noisy on the weekends during the night but didn't keep us awake.  I would go back.

title: Nice Hotel , breakfast could be more better
review: Dear Our Guest ;  thank you for choosing the Suıtel Bosphorus  and for your coments.We are so delighted to heard this words about hotel from you.  We look forward to welcoming you again when your travels bring you to our amazing, magical city.   Yours sincerely,  Havzullah Bayhan Front Desk Manager

title: This was a nice place, a few years ago...
review: very good place to stay with amazing manager abdlah  its in the middle of takseem \near everyhting ,,easy to find taxi ,,easy to do shopping   i suggest it to everyone especially group of freinds coz their rooms are very big and enough space  and good prices

title: All mod cons in the heart of Taksim
review: First of all, I would like to thank you to choose SUITEL BOSPHORUS for your Istanbul visit.  It was very kind of you to spare some of your time and convey us your comments regarding our services.It is a great pleasure to read that you all enjoyed your time with us and we ensured a memorable stay.We are all sending regards for you  We would be more than happy to welcome you again in our hotel  All the best  Havzullah Bayhan Front Desk Manager

title: Very nice, small boutique hotel
review: Great Location, but worn around the edges. The foyer is clean, but worn. The bar area is nice and while we were there they were updating the rear outdoor dining area, it will be nice.The bed and linen's are nice. The Room Safe was never bolted down in the closet (you can walk away with it) kind of funny! There was mold/dirt in and around the shower and around the lavatory sink. The breakfast downstairs is good, you may order from the menu or get the "standard" plate. The resident cat was clean but bothersome at breakfast.

title: Nice !
review: Dear Customer ,  We would like to thank you very much for your kind attention to our Hotel.It was ver kind of you to spare some of your time and convey us your comments regarding our services. We believe that we can improve our services by the comments and suggestions of our guests. We do appreciate your kind contribution to our perfection in this regard.  It will be our pleasure to be your hosts again in the very near future.   We look forward to seeing you soon  best regards  Havzullah Bayhan Fron Desk Manager

title: tarek badr
review: We arrived at this hotel late at night and were welcomed by front desk.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was excellent.  Nurhan (the owner) was very nice and friendly, Havzullah (the manager) was also nice and very accommodating and, Murat at breakfast service always had a smile on his face no matter how many times we asked for more tea :-) I would definitely go back to this hotel.

title: Wonderful hotel close to Taxim Square
review: Dear Guest;  It was a great pleasure to host such a warm and welcoming personality like you here at SUITEL BOSPHORUS  Your review and all good pointing reviews are giving us such a great power and our staff is very proud with the service you enjoy.  Like to thank you for taking time to share your stunning review here on tripadvisor, we love to host you again like your own sweet home here SUITEL BOSPHORUS Best Regards  Havzullah BAYHAN Front Desk Manager

title: Nice location with friendly staff
review: excellent hotel &Amazing team work we loved this hotel very much we will visit turkey zgain very soon & we will choose this hotel in our next visit because its very near from city center &safty alsooooooooooooo

title: Good Location and very friendly staff
review: Istanbul’s most famous street, pedestrianized Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue), throbs day and night and offers a fantastic array of architectural sights, shops, treats, and throngs upon teeming throngs of people. At the avenue’s northeastern end is expansive Taksim Square, thought by many to be the very heart of the city, with many of Turkey’s most renowned restaurants and some of Europe’s most happening nightlife in close proximity. In striking contrast, Beyoglu’s less trafficked areas – such as the affluent Cihangir and the antiques district of Cukurcuma – exude Old World charm and provide contemplative calm and splendid diversion via an assortment of cozy cafes, attractive boutiques, and quiet lanes.

title: Made the trip even more enjoyable
review: We (2 adults and 2 children) stayed at the Suitel in June 2014 for 2 nights at the end of our 7 nights stay in Istanbul. We spent the first 5 nights at a hotel in Sultanhamet (old city). The Suitel was a gamble which paid off since there was only 1 guest review when we booked the hotel through Trip Adviser. It's a new cozy boutique hotel located 3-5 minutes away from Taksim square and Istiqlal street where you have good shopping and plenty of choice for your meals. We stayed in a room with a city view and weren't bothered by the traffic on the street since the windows are double glazed. The hotel has a club in the basement but we didn't hear any noise and there were hardly any patrons frequenting it. The family room was tastefully done up, very clean, with a reasonable sized…

title: Amazing
review: Dear Guest,  We would like to thank you very much for your kind attention to our Hotel.It was ver kind of you to spare some of your time and convey us your comments regarding our services. We believe that we can improve our services by the comments and suggestions of our guests. We do appreciate your kind contribution to our perfection in this regard. We hope to welcome you here in SUITEL BOSPHORUS Istanbul again with all our traditional hospitality.  Yours Sincerely,

title: Thank you
review: Stayed there for a week for a family reunion and was the only group of people that stayed at this hotel while other family members stayed at other not so good hotels. From what was seen in the online pictures the same was seen when i was staying there. The hotel staff were young and very friendly and spoke good English as they were mostly students at a nearby university. The Taksim square is just minutes away where there are long streets for shopping and great nightlife in the after hours. the subway station is also 5 min walk away which connects you the the rest of the city.

title: If you need to sleep in your hotel, don't stay here
review: Dear Guest;  It was a great pleasure to host such a warm and welcoming personality like you here at SUITEL BOSPHORUS Istanbul  Your review and all good pointing reviews are giving us such a great power and our staff is very proud with the service you enjoy. title: outstanding
review: ts a family hotel located in the heart of taksim five min walk from the metro station. the hotel has Big rooms nicely decorated and maintained,amazing view of Bosphorus. The staff was very helpful and welcoming especially the hotel manager Nurhan she looked after us like a family.The Hotel door always locked I strongly recommend this hotel for families with young children.

title: A wonderful week at Suitel Bosphorus
review: Dear Guest;  It was a great pleasure for us to host you here SUITEL BOSPHORUS and would like to thank you for your stunning review here on tripadvisor about our hotel and my team. It’s really great to know such a knowledgeable personality who travelled all over the world.  We would like to host you with a great pleasure again here with your whole family.  Your review is giving us such a great power and our staffs are very proud with the service you enjoy.  BEST REGARD
